snippet: Administration officials said private donations were needed because Congress had provided much less money than President Obama requested to publicize the new law.
abstract: Health and Human Services Sec Kathleen Sebelius has solicited sizable donations from the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation and H&R Block as part of multimillion-dollar campaign to ensure success of Pres Obama's health care law; administration officials say private donations are needed because Congress has provided much less money than Obama requested to publicize new law.
lead_paragraph: Administration officials said private donations were needed because Congress had provided much less money than President Obama requested to publicize the new law.

headline.seo: Health Secretary Raises Funds for Health Care Law
headline.main: Cabinet Secretary Solicits Large Donations to Publicize Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Sebelius Solicits Donations To Publicize Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
